title: Howard Lutnick’s “reputation is in the sewer”
summary:
Yale School of Management’s Jeffrey Sonnenfeld joins Jessica Tarlov and Scott Galloway on Raging Moderates to discuss Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick’s congressional testimony about Jeffrey Epstein.
#epsteinfiles #trump #podcast
transcript_html:
[00:00]

Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnik is testifying  before the Senate. Did you in fact make the visit to Jeffrey Epstein's private island? I did have  lunch with him as I was on a boat going across on a family vacation. This guy's reputation  is in the sewer. He has overtly lied. On that clip you showed, it doesn't demonstrate whether  or not he actually perjured himself under oath, but we do know that he said repeatedly into  recently to the media that as you pointed out was 2005. He's had no more contact with  that disgusting person. And now we see that he not only built a house next door to him, but  he was investing in businesses for years later.

He stayed in contact for 12 years past. He told  us he'd stopped all contact. Based upon what you know about Trump's view and his leadership  style, how do you think that he's going to handle having a cabinet secretary caught in this  kind of lie and the attention that it brings to the administration? If he takes the move on  Lutnik and pushes him out, which he should, does that start the quote unquote proverbial  slippery slope where all the indiscretions of Hegsth and others start to spiral out of  control? could lose Lutnik. Lutnik is not popular on the  cabinet. A lot of CEOs tell us after they shake hands with Howard Lutnik now, they want to wash  their hands. I mean, obviously, they feel soiled.
